The SUV market is expected to experience growth driven by various factors. The automotive industry is currently under constant pressure to adapt to new changes due to technological advancements and end-user preferences. Adoption of electric SUVs is the key factor that has witnessed a rapid change in the SUVs market. In line with the EV sector, development and manufacturing of long-range batteries along with installation of fast and ultra-fast charging points for customers is the foremost agenda of the OEMs and EV solution providing companies. Further, the introduction of autonomous SUVs with enhanced safety features and higher level of automation is shifting the trends in the SUV market. Moreover, OEMs are focused on reducing the production cost of the vehicle by standadizing the platform technology and planning & developing unique platforms for all the SUVs under their brand. Furthermore, Fuel Cell Electric Vehicle (FCEV) SUVs can be a major break-through in the SUVs market. Although the FCEV technology is still in the initial stages, planned research & development is carried out and can become a next major factor in the overall automotive industry, SUVs included. In addition, the current HEVs and BEVs are rapidly growing as several countries in Europe have put forth a strict plan for achieving ZEV targets. EV segment growth to 2030 The BEV, HEV and PHEV segments are expected to lead the SUV market during the forecast period. The growth of EVs is due to the Euro-7 implementation and ICE ban timelines. This has led to new EV SUV launches in 2022 and 2023. Similarly, over 20 new models of electric vehicles are set to launch in 2024 & 2025. This will lead to rapid adoption of EVs SUVs over ICE SUVs. Moreover, long range powered batteries and fast charging public points will lead to overcoming the major restraining factors of the EV market growth. For instance, in December 2023, Toyota launched a new long range Crown Sport PHEV model to cater the Japanese market. Similarly, market leaders such as BMW, Mercedes-Benz and Telsa amongst others have launched long range BEV models in different regional markets in the past two years. Having said that the volume of HEV will rise but till 2030 and will be stagnant for some years and then decline gradually to be replaced by BEVs. This will majorly happen due to the current limited range of the batteries and need to frequently charge the batteries during long distance travel, which will not be an restraint during 2030s. Autonomous SUVs are anticipated to witness growth Autonomous SUVs are projected to grow significantly during the forecast due to the rising demand for safety, comfort, and driving convenience features. By Ajit Dalvi 10 Apr 2025 7008 Views Share - Mahindra & Mahindra has driven into FY2026 on the back of a record fiscal. At 551,487 SUVs sold and robust 20% year-on-year growth (FY2024: 459,877 units), FY2025 was a bumper fiscal year for the company. With an all-SUV portfolio, M&M has, since FY2022 when it sold 225,895 units, successfully surfed the wave of surging demand for most of its models. In FY2025, in terms of model-wise share of sales, the Scorpio twins and the 3XO compact SUV achieved their best-ever fiscal year numbers, together contributing 48% of the company's best-ever fiscal wholesales. By Ajit Dalvi 10 Apr 2025 7008 Views Share - Mahindra & Mahindra has driven into FY2026 on the back of a record fiscal. At 551,487 SUVs sold and robust 20% year-on-year growth (FY2024: 459,877 units), FY2025 was a bumper fiscal year for the company. With an all-SUV portfolio, M&M has, since FY2022 when it sold 225,895 units, successfully surfed the wave of surging demand for most of its models. In FY2025, in terms of model-wise share of sales, the Scorpio twins and the 3XO compact SUV achieved their best-ever fiscal year numbers, together contributing 48% of the company's best-ever fiscal wholesales. The 3XO compact SUV sold 100,906 units in FY2025, up by a massive 84% and an additional 46,180 unitsYoY the highest for any Mahindra SUV in FY2025. The Scorpio sold an additional 23,380 units in FY2025 compared to FY2024. The Mahindra Scorpio twins have had a stellar FY2025. The best-selling Mahindra model the Scorpio N and Scorpio Classic together sold 164,842 units, up 17% YoY (FY2024: 141,462 units), which translates into an additional 23,380 units. The Scorpio N and Classics share of total M&M sales works out to 30%, marginally down from the 31% in FY2024. The fuel-wise split for Scorpio sales in FY2025 is 93% diesel ( 153,395 units) and 7% petrol (11,447 units). The XUV 3XO , which is the reborn avatar of the XUV300, is the model which really provided the fireworks in terms of additional YoY sales. The compact SUV sold 100,923 units in FY2025, up by a massive 84% YoY (FY2024: 54,726 units) this is an additional 46,197 units and the highest for any Mahindra SUV in FY2025. This stellar market performance means the XUV 3XOs share of company sales jumped to 18% from 12% in FY2024. The Mahindra Bolero brand, comprising the Bolero, Bolero Neo and Bolero Neo Plus, sold an estimated 94,750 units in FY2025, down 15% YoY (FY2024: 110,841 units). This sales decline sees the Boleros share of M&M sales drop to 17% from 24% in FY2024. The Bolero is sold only with a diesel powertrain. Flagship SUV Mahindra XUV700 continues to witness strong demand. At 93,082 units, sales were up 17% YoY (FY2024: 79,398 units), giving the model a 17% share, the same as in FY2024. Year on year, an additional 27,836 units. The fuel-wise sales split for the XUV700 in FY2025 is 75% diesel ( 70,172 units) and 25% petrol (22,910 units). In FY2024, the XUV700s 79,398 units were split between 71% diesel (56,366 units) and 29% petrol (23,032 units). The Mahindra Thar is the fifth best-selling model for M&M with 84,834 units, up 30% YoY (FY2024: 65,246 units) and an additional 19,588 units in FY2025. The Mahindra XUV700 found more than 6,500 takers in March 2024, with which its monthly sales remained consistent. By Ajit Dalvi 10 Apr 2025 7008 Views Share - Mahindra & Mahindra has driven into FY2026 on the back of a record fiscal. At 551,487 SUVs sold and robust 20% year-on-year growth (FY2024: 459,877 units), FY2025 was a bumper fiscal year for the company. With an all-SUV portfolio, M&M has, since FY2022 when it sold 225,895 units, successfully surfed the wave of surging demand for most of its models. In FY2025, in terms of model-wise share of sales, the Scorpio twins and the 3XO compact SUV achieved their best-ever fiscal year numbers, together contributing 48% of the company's best-ever fiscal wholesales. The 3XO compact SUV sold 100,906 units in FY2025, up by a massive 84% and an additional 46,180 unitsYoY the highest for any Mahindra SUV in FY2025. The Scorpio sold an additional 23,380 units in FY2025 compared to FY2024. The Mahindra Scorpio twins have had a stellar FY2025. The best-selling Mahindra model the Scorpio N and Scorpio Classic together sold 164,842 units, up 17% YoY (FY2024: 141,462 units), which translates into an additional 23,380 units. The Scorpio N and Classics share of total M&M sales works out to 30%, marginally down from the 31% in FY2024. The fuel-wise split for Scorpio sales in FY2025 is 93% diesel ( 153,395 units) and 7% petrol (11,447 units). The XUV 3XO , which is the reborn avatar of the XUV300, is the model which really provided the fireworks in terms of additional YoY sales. The compact SUV sold 100,923 units in FY2025, up by a massive 84% YoY (FY2024: 54,726 units) this is an additional 46,197 units and the highest for any Mahindra SUV in FY2025. This stellar market performance means the XUV 3XOs share of company sales jumped to 18% from 12% in FY2024. The Mahindra Bolero brand, comprising the Bolero, Bolero Neo and Bolero Neo Plus, sold an estimated 94,750 units in FY2025, down 15% YoY (FY2024: 110,841 units). This sales decline sees the Boleros share of M&M sales drop to 17% from 24% in FY2024. The Bolero is sold only with a diesel powertrain. Flagship SUV Mahindra XUV700 continues to witness strong demand. At 93,082 units, sales were up 17% YoY (FY2024: 79,398 units), giving the model a 17% share, the same as in FY2024. Year on year, an additional 27,836 units. The fuel-wise sales split for the XUV700 in FY2025 is 75% diesel ( 70,172 units) and 25% petrol (22,910 units). In FY2024, the XUV700s 79,398 units were split between 71% diesel (56,366 units) and 29% petrol (23,032 units). The Mahindra Thar is the fifth best-selling model for M&M with 84,834 units, up 30% YoY (FY2024: 65,246 units) and an additional 19,588 units in FY2025. Published On Jul 10, 2025 04:21:00 PM 1,06,445 Views Follow us on By Saptarshi Mondal Share - The Mahindra XUV 3XO , formerly XUV300, was launched last year with all-new front and rear designs, a refreshed interior and more features, as well as new powertrain options. Currently priced from Rs 7.99 lakh to Rs 15.79 lakh, ex-showroom India, this Mahindra SUV is available in a total of 12 trim levels (see table below). In this feature, we take a closer look at what features and engine options you get with each trim. Mahindra XUV 3XO petrol variant prices (in Rs, lakh) Petrol-MT Petrol-AT Diesel-MT Diesel-AMT MX1 7.99 - - - RevX M 8.94 - - - RevX M(O) 9.44 - - - MX2 - - 9.99 - MX2 Pro 9.54 10.54 10.64 - MX3 9.74 11.40 10.99 11.79 MX3 Pro 9.99 11.69 11.56 - AX5 11.19 12.69 12.19 12.99 RevX A T-GDI 11.79 12.99 - - AX5L T-GDI 12.62 13.94 - - AX7 T-GDI 12.80 13.99 13.69 14.70 AX7L T-GDI 13.99 15.80 14.99 - Mahindra XUV 3XO variant-wise powertrains The XUV 3XO's engine options include a 111hp, 200Nm, 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine, 131hp, 230Nm, 1.2-litre TGDI engine and 117hp, 300Nm, and 1.5-litre diesel engine.A 6-speed manual gearbox is standard with these engines.Also, both petrol engines get a 6-speed torque converter automatic gearbox, while the diesel XUV 3XO models come with a 6-speed AMT unit. The 111hp turbo-petrol engine is available on the MX1, RevX M, RevX M(O), MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro and the AX5 trims. Moving on, the 131hp turbo-petrol engine is available only on the top four trims - RevX A, AX5 L, AX7 and AX7 L. The diesel engine is available nearly across the board, starting from the fourth-from-base MX2 trim. Here's a look at the variant split of the new XUV 3XO. AUTO PUNDITZ February 2025 Mahindra Sales Analysis YoY, MoM Change, 6-Month Trend V3Cars Mar 20 4 min read In this February 2025 Mahindra car sales analysis, well look at the car sales of Mahindra for the previous month. Well also compare the YoY and MoM change to find out which Mahindra cars sales improved and which ones declined. To support the trends, well also provide our opinions where applicable. Lastly, the table with monthly sales for the last 6 months will give you an idea about the 6-month sales trend of all Mahindra cars. Mission Accomplished! Mahindra have finally managed to secure the 2nd spot for the first time ever. While Tata Motors have enjoyed the 2nd position a few times, this is an achievement for Mahindra. With a 13.24% market share in Feb 2025, Mahindra were only behind Maruti Suzuki while Hyundai and Tata secured 12.54% and 12.20% market share. We shouldnt expect anyone to beat Maruti Suzuki any time soon. So, 2nd spot is as high as any other carmaker can go and thats where well see Hyundai, Tata and Mahindra fighting it out in the coming months. They usually say once a flop, always a flop. But Mahindra showed the industry how they can turn around a flop product and turn it into a success. The XUV 300 did well for itself but it was not a sales success in its segment where segment leaders routinely hit close to 15,000 dispatches every month. It looked like it was impossible to turn its fate around but Mahindra did exactly that, that too in a much too crowded market. It has managed to make space for itself as it continues with a typical monthly dispatch figure of 7,000 - 9,000 averaging at 8,256. The fact that they achieved this with what the industry calls a mid-life update makes it all the more special. They not only gave it a new yet recognizable name, they revamped its exterior and interior design, revised the variant lineup, feature distribution and added a few segment first features to earn buyers respect. But what helped it the most was its value for money pricing. From there, like one sledgehammer hit after another, they brought out the new age electric cars and that finally got them enough volumes to beat Hyundai and attain 2nd place in Feb 2025. If the journey to get this far was tough, we can expect the path forward to be tougher for Mahindra. Tata & Hyundai are still not too far behind. Its going to be interesting to see the 3 manufacturers battling it out to grab the 2nd spot going forward until one of them leaves the other two so far behind that they instead focus on staying on the podium instead. The standard 1.2-litre turbo petrol puts out 115 PS and 200 Nm while a more potent 1.2-litre direct injection version steps things up to 130 PS and 250 Nm. For those leaning toward diesel, the 1.5-litre four-cylinder unit churns out 117 PS along with a meaty 300 Nm of torque. By Ajit Dalvi 14 Feb 2025 12986 Views Share - The Mahindra XUV300, reborn in a new avatar in April 2024 as the XUV 3XO , turns six years old today. Launched on February 14 and Valentines Day in 2019, the popular compact SUV has, till end-January 2025, has sold a total of 335,017 units. Thanks to the XUV 3XO, this compact Mahindra SUVs growth trajectory is currently at its best yet since launch, having sold 85,990 units, up 80% YoY (April 2023-January 2024: 47,672 units). The launch of the XUV 3XO (above right) in April 2024 has accelerated sales. The 85,990 units sold in the first 10 months of FY2025 are up 80% YoY. At this pace, the 3XO will go on to hit the 100,000-units sales mark in FY2025. Not only are the XUV 3XOs sales in the first 10 months of FY2025 already the highest in a fiscal, having beaten the previous best of 60,968 units of FY2023, but with February-March 2025 sales yet to be pencilled in, they are set to hit the 100,000 sales mark in FY2025. In the process, this models cumulative sales since launch will also surpass 350,000 units. Whats amply clear is that the rollout of the XUV 3XO in end-April 2024 has accelerated sales. Year-on-year, M&M has sold an additional 38,318 units. This compact SUV is currently the second best-selling Mahindra SUV after the Scorpio twins (137,311 units). That the XUV300 would become another Mahindra high-selling SUV was seen soon after launch seven years ago the company received 13,000 bookings in the first 28 days . The Mahindra compact SUV went on to hit 200,000 sales in May 2023 , 47 months after launch. The 300,000 milestone came up 16 months later in early October 2024. Given the current rapid pace of sales, the 400,000 sales milestone should be achieved in even fewer months. At present, the 3XO is 65,747 units away from that big number and should hit it around August-September 2025. What is helping accelerate sales for this SUV is the gains coming from M&Ms heightened focus on safety. In mid-November 2024, the XUV 3XO, along with the Thar Roxx and XUV400, aced the Bharat NCAP crash test . These models have now joined Mahindras growing portfolio of five-star-rated vehicles, which includes the XUV700 and Scorpio-N. 3X0 AS A SALES ACCELERATOR TO MAHINDRAS STELLAR GROWTH In FY2024, with 54,726 units, the XUV300 contributed 12% to the companys dealer dispatches and was among the prime movers that powered M&M to its best-ever fiscal year sales of 459,877 units and also among Indias Top 20 best-selling utility vehicles in FY2024 . Last fiscal, the XUV300 was the fifth high-selling Mahindra SUV model in FY2024 after the Scorpio, Bolero, XUV700 and the Thar. xuv_3xo_features.text: [{'url': 'https://www.team-bhp.com/news/2024-mahindra-xuv-3xo-review-8-pros-7-cons', 'content': "2024 Mahindra XUV 3XO Review : 8 Pros & 7 Cons | Team-BHP Skip to main content About Us | Advertise | Contact Us Forum Hot Threads News Reviews Photos Buy Used Car Spare Parts Buy Accessories Classifieds Store News 2024 Mahindra XUV 3XO Review : 8 Pros & 7 Cons 8th May 2024, 12:20 by Omkar Shendge View Forum Discussion It gets a refreshed exterior, some changes to the interiors, quite a few feature additions and a new 6-speed Aisin-sourced automatic gearbox for its petrol engines. Mahindra XUV 3XO Pros A truly premium crossover. Nice build, quality & refinement levels Cabin has enough space for 5. Quality-wise, the interior is more like a Hyundai Fantastic petrol & diesel engine line-up; they offer fast performance & good driveability Finally gets a smooth torque converter automatic with the turbo-petrol engines Wide variant spread ensures there's something for everyone A compliant ride with sorted road manners 5-star NCAP rating & kit. Level 2 ADAS, 6 airbags, ESP, ABS, all-wheel disc brakes, TPMS, seatbelt reminders for all & more Loaded to the gills with equipment (360-degree camera, big sunroof, drive modes, Harman Kardon audio system, wireless smartphone connectivity, auto headlamps & wipers etc.) Mahindra XUV 3XO Cons The new edgy & outlandish design may not be to everyone's liking. Some love it, some don't. It is very polarizing Top-end variants are expensive. Not overpriced, but definitely higher than expected 295-liter boot is the smallest in the segment. There are cheaper hatchbacks that have a larger boot No proper diesel automatic option, just a jerky AMT which has no place in a premium crossover Light & disconnected steering is the biggest drawback in a competent handling package Mahindra's after-sales service quality is a hit or miss. Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications Specification Details Price Range Rs. 7.99 15.80 Lakh (ex-showroom) Engine Options 1.2L Turbo Petrol (110 bhp), 1.2L TGDi (129 bhp), 1.5L Diesel (115 bhp) Transmission 6-speed Manual, 6-speed Automatic, 6-speed AMT Safety Rating 5-star BNCAP Mileage 17.96-21.2 kmpl (ARAI) Boot Space 295 liters Fuel Tank 42 liters Ground Clearance 201 mm Wheelbase 2600 mm Seating Capacity 5 passengers Engine and Variants The XUV 3XO continues with the same set of engines seen on theolder version, with three options. The highlight is new 1.2-litreTGDi direct injection petrol, good 129 bhp and 230 Nm. Theres adequate mid-rangepunch in this engine and highway overtaking is a breeze. The new torque converter automatic transmission works well with both petrol engines, smoother than the jerky AMT. For diesel lovers, the 1.5-litre turbo diesel continues to be the best in class with 300 Nm torque. The manual transmission is seamless, but the AMT is reluctant in lower gears, especially in stop-and-go traffic. Design and Styling Updates Mahindra has completely redesigned the XUV 3XOs exterior. The side profile has chunky cladding and 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels on higher variants. Mahindra has given the XUV 3XO a free-standing 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system and matching digital instrument cluster, same as the XUV700. Space is excellent, with class-leading rear legroom for 5 adults. The dashboard has soft-touch materials and premium finishes on higher variants and plenty of storage spaces for practicality. Key Features: Panoramic sunroof (segment-first) Dual-zone automatic climate control 360-degree camera system Electronic parking brake with auto-hold Level 2 ADAS on top variants Safety and Build The XUV 3XOs biggest achievement is its 5-star BNCAP rating, making it one of the safest in the segment. All variants come with six airbags, all-wheel disc brakes and comprehensive safety features like ABS, EBD and ESP. Higher variants get advanced driver assistance features like forward collision warning, autonomous emergency braking, adaptive cruise control and lane-keep assist. The build quality is robust and users often praise it as tank-like. Mahindra XUV 3XO: design and styling Where the XUV300s styling was understated, the XUV 3XO is big on flash. report_sections.heading: Mahindra XUV 3XO Overview
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compact SUV that blends bold design with advanced technology. Launched in April 2024, it is a refreshed version of the XUV300, featuring significant upgrades in design and technology. The SUV boasts a bold front grille, connected LED tail lamps, and a panoramic sunroof. Inside, it offers dual 10.25-inch displays for the infotainment system and driver's instrument cluster, wireless charging, and a cooled glove box. It comes with level 2 ADAS and 6 airbags and electronic stability control.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section provides a general overview of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, including its design, features, and key specifications.
bullet_points: Mahindra XUV 3XO is a refreshed version of the XUV300.
The SUV features a bold design with connected LED tail lamps.
It offers dual 10.25-inch displays for infotainment and instrument cluster.
Safety is prioritized with Level 2 ADAS and six airbags.

report_sections.heading: Detailed Analysis of Luxury and Safety Features
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a range of luxury and safety features that enhance the driving experience and ensure passenger safety. Luxury features include a panoramic sunroof, premium audio system, wireless charging, and a cooled glove box. Safety features include six airbags, Electronic Stability Control (ESC), ABS, all-wheel disc brakes, TPMS, seatbelt reminders for all passengers, and Level 2 ADAS. The ADAS features include forward collision warning, autonomous emergency braking, adaptive cruise control, and lane-keep assist.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section provides an in-depth analysis of the luxury and safety features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, highlighting the key technologies and their benefits.
bullet_points: Mahindra XUV 3XO offers luxury features like panoramic sunroof and premium audio.
The car has six airbags, ESC, ABS, and all-wheel disc brakes for enhanced safety.
It is equipped with Level 2 ADAS for advanced driver assistance.
The safety features are a core selling point, making it a safe choice for family SUV

report_sections.heading: Sales Performance Analysis
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO has demonstrated strong sales performance since its launch. In June 2025, the total sales figure of XUV 3XO was 7,089 units, which represents a 10.85% MoM decline. The SUV recorded 98,091 unit sales in FY2024-25 (April 2024 to March 2025 period) as against 53,962 units during the same period the previous fiscal, witnessing a YoY sales surge of 82%. The launch month of May 2024 saw 10,000 units dispatched, setting a strong tone right from the start. These figures demonstrate the growing demand for the XUV 3XO in the Indian market.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section analyzes the sales performance of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, including monthly sales figures, YoY growth, and market share.
bullet_points: Total sales for June 2025 stood at 7,089 units.
FY2024-25 sales recorded 98,091 units, representing 82% YoY growth.
In May 2024 Mahindra dispatched 10,000 units of XUV 3XO.
The XUV 3XO drives the brand's monthly numbers.

report_sections.heading: Market Trends and Future Outlook
report_sections.content: The SUV market is expected to continue its growth trajectory, driven by factors such as increasing disposable incomes, urbanization, and the demand for versatile vehicles. Electric SUVs are poised to gain prominence as automakers invest in sustainable technologies and governments implement stricter emission regulations. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is well-positioned to capitalize on these trends, with its competitive pricing, advanced features, and focus on safety. Future models include both fully electric and hybrid.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section discusses the future trends in the SUV market and the potential opportunities for the Mahindra XUV 3XO.
bullet_points: SUV market is expected to grow due to rising incomes and urbanization.

Mahindra XUV 3XO is well-positioned to capitalize on these trends.
Future models will likely include electric and hybrid options.

report_sections.heading: Conclusion
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compelling subcompact SUV that offers a blend of style, performance, safety, and advanced features. It has demonstrated strong sales performance and is well-positioned to compete in the growing SUV market. The SUV's comprehensive safety features, luxurious interiors, and competitive pricing make it an attractive option for consumers looking for a versatile and reliable vehicle. Mahindra's commitment to innovation and safety will likely further strengthen the XUV 3XO's position in the market.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compact SUV that blends bold design with advanced technology. The SUV boasts a bold front grille, connected LED tail lamps, and a panoramic sunroof. Inside, it offers dual 10.25-inch displays for the infotainment system and driver's instrument cluster, wireless charging, and a cooled glove box. Detailed Analysis of Luxury and Safety Features.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a range of luxury and safety features that enhance the driving experience and ensure passenger safety. Sales Performance Analysis.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has demonstrated strong sales performance since its launch. In June 2025, the total sales figure of XUV 3XO was 7,089 units, which represents a 10.85% MoM decline. The SUV recorded 98,091 unit sales in FY2024-25 (April 2024 to March 2025 period) as against 53,962 units during the same period the previous fiscal, witnessing a YoY sales surge of 82%. The launch month of May 2024 saw 10,000 units dispatched, setting a strong tone right from the start. These figures demonstrate the growing demand for the XUV 3XO in the Indian market.

The SUV market is expected to continue its growth trajectory, driven by factors such as increasing disposable incomes, urbanization, and the demand for versatile vehicles. Electric SUVs are poised to gain prominence as automakers invest in sustainable technologies and governments implement stricter emission regulations. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is well-positioned to capitalize on these trends, with its competitive pricing, advanced features, and focus on safety. Future models include both fully electric and hybrid.

  • Future models will likely include electric and hybrid options.

Conclusion.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compelling subcompact SUV that offers a blend of style, performance, safety, and advanced features. It has demonstrated strong sales performance and is well-positioned to compete in the growing SUV market. The SUV's comprehensive safety features, luxurious interiors, and competitive pricing make it an attractive option for consumers looking for a versatile and reliable vehicle. Mahindra's commitment to innovation and safety will likely further strengthen the XUV 3XO's position in the market.

The company achieved a record-breaking milestone, surpassing 50,000 monthly unit sales for the first time, with 51,062 units sold. This contributed to a total sales figure of 87,839 units, marking Mahindras highest-ever monthly sales and setting a new benchmark for the automaker. In comparison to the same period last year, when Mahindra sold 41,267 units, the brand demonstrated substantial year-on-year growth. In August 2024, Mahindra sold 43,277 units, leading to a month-on-month sales increase of nearly 18 per cent. This performance has propelled Mahindra up the overall monthly sales rankings, moving into third place by surpassing Tata Motors in the standings. The Scorpio range posted 14,438 units as against 11,846 units during the same period twelve months ago with a YoY sales increase of 22 per cent. Mahindra Marazzo (-95%)\t7\t144 The Mahindra XUV700 was the second most sold model within the brands portfolio with a domestic tally of 9,646 units as against 8,555 units in September 2023 with a YoY growth of 13 per cent. With an all-SUV portfolio, M&M has, since FY2022 when it sold 225,895 units, successfully surfed the wave of surging demand for most of its models. In FY2025, in terms of model-wise share of sales, the Scorpio twins and the 3XO compact SUV achieved their best-ever fiscal year numbers, together contributing 48% of the company's best-ever fiscal wholesales. The 3XO compact SUV sold 100,906 units in FY2025, up by a massive 84% and an additional 46,180 unitsYoY the highest for any Mahindra SUV in FY2025. The Scorpio sold an additional 23,380 units in FY2025 compared to FY2024. The Mahindra Scorpio twins have had a stellar FY2025. The best-selling Mahindra model the Scorpio N and Scorpio Classic together sold 164,842 units, up 17% YoY (FY2024: 141,462 units), which translates into an additional 23,380 units. The Scorpio N and Classics share of total M&M sales works out to 30%, marginally down from the 31% in FY2024. The fuel-wise split for Scorpio sales in FY2025 is 93% diesel ( 153,395 units) and 7% petrol (11,447 units). The XUV 3XO , which is the reborn avatar of the XUV300, is the model which really provided the fireworks in terms of additional YoY sales. The compact SUV sold 100,923 units in FY2025, up by a massive 84% YoY (FY2024: 54,726 units) this is an additional 46,197 units and the highest for any Mahindra SUV in FY2025. This stellar market performance means the XUV 3XOs share of company sales jumped to 18% from 12% in FY2024. The Mahindra Bolero brand, comprising the Bolero, Bolero Neo and Bolero Neo Plus, sold an estimated 94,750 units in FY2025, down 15% YoY (FY2024: 110,841 units). This sales decline sees the Boleros share of M&M sales drop to 17% from 24% in FY2024. The Bolero is sold only with a diesel powertrain. Flagship SUV Mahindra XUV700 continues to witness strong demand. At 93,082 units, sales were up 17% YoY (FY2024: 79,398 units), giving the model a 17% share, the same as in FY2024. Year on year, an additional 27,836 units. The fuel-wise sales split for the XUV700 in FY2025 is 75% diesel ( 70,172 units) and 25% petrol (22,910 units). In FY2024, the XUV700s 79,398 units were split between 71% diesel (56,366 units) and 29% petrol (23,032 units). The Mahindra Thar is the fifth best-selling model for M&M with 84,834 units, up 30% YoY (FY2024: 65,246 units) and an additional 19,588 units in FY2025. Mahindra dominates, but challengers arent far behind. If youre even slightly interested in SUVs, March 2025 has been one of the most telling months in the segment. Mid size SUVs have become the go to choice for Indian families, adventure seekers, and urban commuters alike. And with more brands launching feature packed models, the battle for supremacy has never been closer. Mahindra has clearly capitalised on the trend, with Scorpio and XUV700 leading the charts . But Hyundai, Toyota, Tata, and MG are not letting go of their market share without a fight. Lets break down the brand wise sales numbers, what they reveal about consumer preferences, and which SUV is winning hearts across India. Table of Contents Toggle Mahindra Dominates March 2025 with Scorpio and XUV700 Hyundai Alcazar Holds Its Ground Toyota Hyryder and Maruti Grand Vitara: Steady Hybrid Contenders MG Hector Sees a Mild Uptick Tata Harrier: Good Product, But Needs a Push March 2025 Mid Size SUV Sales Chart: Brand wise Breakdown Whats Driving the Surge in Mid Size SUV Sales? The mid size SUV segments 5.05% FY25 growth reflects strong demand, driven by: How They Stack Up Why Im Pumped About This What to Expect in the Coming Months Conclusion: Mahindra Stays on Top but the Mid Size SUV Race is Just Getting Started Divyani Mahindra Dominates March 2025 with Scorpio and XUV700 Mahindra continues to set the pace in the mid size SUV market, led by its rugged and feature rich offerings. By Ajit Dalvi 10 Apr 2025 7008 Views Share - Mahindra & Mahindra has driven into FY2026 on the back of a record fiscal. At 551,487 SUVs sold and robust 20% year-on-year growth (FY2024: 459,877 units), FY2025 was a bumper fiscal year for the company. With an all-SUV portfolio, M&M has, since FY2022 when it sold 225,895 units, successfully surfed the wave of surging demand for most of its models. In FY2025, in terms of model-wise share of sales, the Scorpio twins and the 3XO compact SUV achieved their best-ever fiscal year numbers, together contributing 48% of the company's best-ever fiscal wholesales. The 3XO compact SUV sold 100,906 units in FY2025, up by a massive 84% and an additional 46,180 unitsYoY the highest for any Mahindra SUV in FY2025. The Scorpio sold an additional 23,380 units in FY2025 compared to FY2024. The Mahindra Scorpio twins have had a stellar FY2025. The best-selling Mahindra model the Scorpio N and Scorpio Classic together sold 164,842 units, up 17% YoY (FY2024: 141,462 units), which translates into an additional 23,380 units. The Scorpio N and Classics share of total M&M sales works out to 30%, marginally down from the 31% in FY2024. The fuel-wise split for Scorpio sales in FY2025 is 93% diesel ( 153,395 units) and 7% petrol (11,447 units). The XUV 3XO , which is the reborn avatar of the XUV300, is the model which really provided the fireworks in terms of additional YoY sales. The compact SUV sold 100,923 units in FY2025, up by a massive 84% YoY (FY2024: 54,726 units) this is an additional 46,197 units and the highest for any Mahindra SUV in FY2025. This stellar market performance means the XUV 3XOs share of company sales jumped to 18% from 12% in FY2024. The Mahindra Bolero brand, comprising the Bolero, Bolero Neo and Bolero Neo Plus, sold an estimated 94,750 units in FY2025, down 15% YoY (FY2024: 110,841 units). This sales decline sees the Boleros share of M&M sales drop to 17% from 24% in FY2024. The Bolero is sold only with a diesel powertrain. Flagship SUV Mahindra XUV700 continues to witness strong demand. At 93,082 units, sales were up 17% YoY (FY2024: 79,398 units), giving the model a 17% share, the same as in FY2024. Year on year, an additional 27,836 units. The fuel-wise sales split for the XUV700 in FY2025 is 75% diesel ( 70,172 units) and 25% petrol (22,910 units). In FY2024, the XUV700s 79,398 units were split between 71% diesel (56,366 units) and 29% petrol (23,032 units). The Mahindra Thar is the fifth best-selling model for M&M with 84,834 units, up 30% YoY (FY2024: 65,246 units) and an additional 19,588 units in FY2025. By Ajit Dalvi 10 Apr 2025 7008 Views Share - Mahindra & Mahindra has driven into FY2026 on the back of a record fiscal. At 551,487 SUVs sold and robust 20% year-on-year growth (FY2024: 459,877 units), FY2025 was a bumper fiscal year for the company. With an all-SUV portfolio, M&M has, since FY2022 when it sold 225,895 units, successfully surfed the wave of surging demand for most of its models. In FY2025, in terms of model-wise share of sales, the Scorpio twins and the 3XO compact SUV achieved their best-ever fiscal year numbers, together contributing 48% of the company's best-ever fiscal wholesales. The 3XO compact SUV sold 100,906 units in FY2025, up by a massive 84% and an additional 46,180 unitsYoY the highest for any Mahindra SUV in FY2025. The Scorpio sold an additional 23,380 units in FY2025 compared to FY2024. The Mahindra Scorpio twins have had a stellar FY2025. The best-selling Mahindra model the Scorpio N and Scorpio Classic together sold 164,842 units, up 17% YoY (FY2024: 141,462 units), which translates into an additional 23,380 units. The Scorpio N and Classics share of total M&M sales works out to 30%, marginally down from the 31% in FY2024. The fuel-wise split for Scorpio sales in FY2025 is 93% diesel ( 153,395 units) and 7% petrol (11,447 units). The XUV 3XO , which is the reborn avatar of the XUV300, is the model which really provided the fireworks in terms of additional YoY sales. The compact SUV sold 100,923 units in FY2025, up by a massive 84% YoY (FY2024: 54,726 units) this is an additional 46,197 units and the highest for any Mahindra SUV in FY2025. This stellar market performance means the XUV 3XOs share of company sales jumped to 18% from 12% in FY2024. The Mahindra Bolero brand, comprising the Bolero, Bolero Neo and Bolero Neo Plus, sold an estimated 94,750 units in FY2025, down 15% YoY (FY2024: 110,841 units). This sales decline sees the Boleros share of M&M sales drop to 17% from 24% in FY2024. The Bolero is sold only with a diesel powertrain. Pune Hyderabad Ahmedabad Chennai Kolkata Home Features Mahindra XUV 3XO price, variants, features explained Mahindra XUV 3XO price, variants, features explained The XUV 3XO recently added new RevX variants, which are offered with two turbo-petrol engine options. Published On Jul 10, 2025 04:21:00 PM 1,06,445 Views Follow us on By Saptarshi Mondal Share - The Mahindra XUV 3XO , formerly XUV300, was launched last year with all-new front and rear designs, a refreshed interior and more features, as well as new powertrain options. Currently priced from Rs 7.99 lakh to Rs 15.79 lakh, ex-showroom India, this Mahindra SUV is available in a total of 12 trim levels (see table below). In this feature, we take a closer look at what features and engine options you get with each trim. Mahindra XUV 3XO petrol variant prices (in Rs, lakh) Petrol-MT Petrol-AT Diesel-MT Diesel-AMT MX1 7.99 - - - RevX M 8.94 - - - RevX M(O) 9.44 - - - MX2 - - 9.99 - MX2 Pro 9.54 10.54 10.64 - MX3 9.74 11.40 10.99 11.79 MX3 Pro 9.99 11.69 11.56 - AX5 11.19 12.69 12.19 12.99 RevX A T-GDI 11.79 12.99 - - AX5L T-GDI 12.62 13.94 - - AX7 T-GDI 12.80 13.99 13.69 14.70 AX7L T-GDI 13.99 15.80 14.99 - Mahindra XUV 3XO variant-wise powertrains The XUV 3XO's engine options include a 111hp, 200Nm, 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine, 131hp, 230Nm, 1.2-litre TGDI engine and 117hp, 300Nm, and 1.5-litre diesel engine.A 6-speed manual gearbox is standard with these engines.Also, both petrol engines get a 6-speed torque converter automatic gearbox, while the diesel XUV 3XO models come with a 6-speed AMT unit. The 111hp turbo-petrol engine is available on the MX1, RevX M, RevX M(O), MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro and the AX5 trims. Moving on, the 131hp turbo-petrol engine is available only on the top four trims - RevX A, AX5 L, AX7 and AX7 L. The diesel engine is available nearly across the board, starting from the fourth-from-base MX2 trim. Here's a look at the variant split of the new XUV 3XO. variants, which are offered with two turbo-petrol engine options. Published On Jul 10, 2025 04:21:00 PM 1,06,445 Views Follow us on By Saptarshi Mondal Share - The Mahindra XUV 3XO , formerly XUV300, was launched last year with all-new front and rear designs, a refreshed interior and more features, as well as new powertrain options. Currently priced from Rs 7.99 lakh to Rs 15.79 lakh, ex-showroom India, this Mahindra SUV is available in a total of 12 trim levels (see table below). In this feature, we take a closer look at what features and engine options you get with each trim. Mahindra XUV 3XO petrol variant prices (in Rs, lakh) Petrol-MT Petrol-AT Diesel-MT Diesel-AMT MX1 7.99 - - - RevX M 8.94 - - - RevX M(O) 9.44 - - - MX2 - - 9.99 - MX2 Pro 9.54 10.54 10.64 - MX3 9.74 11.40 10.99 11.79 MX3 Pro 9.99 11.69 11.56 - AX5 11.19 12.69 12.19 12.99 RevX A T-GDI 11.79 12.99 - - AX5L T-GDI 12.62 13.94 - - AX7 T-GDI 12.80 13.99 13.69 14.70 AX7L T-GDI 13.99 15.80 14.99 - Mahindra XUV 3XO variant-wise powertrains The XUV 3XO's engine options include a 111hp, 200Nm, 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine, 131hp, 230Nm, 1.2-litre TGDI engine and 117hp, 300Nm, and 1.5-litre diesel engine.A 6-speed manual gearbox is standard with these engines.Also, both petrol engines get a 6-speed torque converter automatic gearbox, while the diesel XUV 3XO models come with a 6-speed AMT unit. The 111hp turbo-petrol engine is available on the MX1, RevX M, RevX M(O), MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro and the AX5 trims. Moving on, the 131hp turbo-petrol engine is available only on the top four trims - RevX A, AX5 L, AX7 and AX7 L. The diesel engine is available nearly across the board, starting from the fourth-from-base MX2 trim. Here's a look at the variant split of the new XUV 3XO. AUTO PUNDITZ February 2025 Mahindra Sales Analysis YoY, MoM Change, 6-Month Trend V3Cars Mar 20 4 min read In this February 2025 Mahindra car sales analysis, well look at the car sales of Mahindra for the previous month. Well also compare the YoY and MoM change to find out which Mahindra cars sales improved and which ones declined. To support the trends, well also provide our opinions where applicable. Lastly, the table with monthly sales for the last 6 months will give you an idea about the 6-month sales trend of all Mahindra cars. Mission Accomplished! Mahindra have finally managed to secure the 2nd spot for the first time ever. While Tata Motors have enjoyed the 2nd position a few times, this is an achievement for Mahindra. With a 13.24% market share in Feb 2025, Mahindra were only behind Maruti Suzuki while Hyundai and Tata secured 12.54% and 12.20% market share. We shouldnt expect anyone to beat Maruti Suzuki any time soon. So, 2nd spot is as high as any other carmaker can go and thats where well see Hyundai, Tata and Mahindra fighting it out in the coming months. They usually say once a flop, always a flop. But Mahindra showed the industry how they can turn around a flop product and turn it into a success. The XUV 300 did well for itself but it was not a sales success in its segment where segment leaders routinely hit close to 15,000 dispatches every month. It looked like it was impossible to turn its fate around but Mahindra did exactly that, that too in a much too crowded market. It has managed to make space for itself as it continues with a typical monthly dispatch figure of 7,000 - 9,000 averaging at 8,256. The fact that they achieved this with what the industry calls a mid-life update makes it all the more special. They not only gave it a new yet recognizable name, they revamped its exterior and interior design, revised the variant lineup, feature distribution and added a few segment first features to earn buyers respect. But what helped it the most was its value for money pricing. From there, like one sledgehammer hit after another, they brought out the new age electric cars and that finally got them enough volumes to beat Hyundai and attain 2nd place in Feb 2025. If the journey to get this far was tough, we can expect the path forward to be tougher for Mahindra. Tata & Hyundai are still not too far behind. Its going to be interesting to see the 3 manufacturers battling it out to grab the 2nd spot going forward until one of them leaves the other two so far behind that they instead focus on staying on the podium instead. By Ajit Dalvi 14 Feb 2025 12986 Views Share - The Mahindra XUV300, reborn in a new avatar in April 2024 as the XUV 3XO , turns six years old today. Launched on February 14 and Valentines Day in 2019, the popular compact SUV has, till end-January 2025, has sold a total of 335,017 units. Thanks to the XUV 3XO, this compact Mahindra SUVs growth trajectory is currently at its best yet since launch, having sold 85,990 units, up 80% YoY (April 2023-January 2024: 47,672 units). The launch of the XUV 3XO (above right) in April 2024 has accelerated sales. The 85,990 units sold in the first 10 months of FY2025 are up 80% YoY. At this pace, the 3XO will go on to hit the 100,000-units sales mark in FY2025. Not only are the XUV 3XOs sales in the first 10 months of FY2025 already the highest in a fiscal, having beaten the previous best of 60,968 units of FY2023, but with February-March 2025 sales yet to be pencilled in, they are set to hit the 100,000 sales mark in FY2025. In the process, this models cumulative sales since launch will also surpass 350,000 units. Whats amply clear is that the rollout of the XUV 3XO in end-April 2024 has accelerated sales. Year-on-year, M&M has sold an additional 38,318 units. This compact SUV is currently the second best-selling Mahindra SUV after the Scorpio twins (137,311 units). That the XUV300 would become another Mahindra high-selling SUV was seen soon after launch seven years ago the company received 13,000 bookings in the first 28 days . The Mahindra compact SUV went on to hit 200,000 sales in May 2023 , 47 months after launch. The 300,000 milestone came up 16 months later in early October 2024. Given the current rapid pace of sales, the 400,000 sales milestone should be achieved in even fewer months. At present, the 3XO is 65,747 units away from that big number and should hit it around August-September 2025. What is helping accelerate sales for this SUV is the gains coming from M&Ms heightened focus on safety. In mid-November 2024, the XUV 3XO, along with the Thar Roxx and XUV400, aced the Bharat NCAP crash test . These models have now joined Mahindras growing portfolio of five-star-rated vehicles, which includes the XUV700 and Scorpio-N. 3X0 AS A SALES ACCELERATOR TO MAHINDRAS STELLAR GROWTH In FY2024, with 54,726 units, the XUV300 contributed 12% to the companys dealer dispatches and was among the prime movers that powered M&M to its best-ever fiscal year sales of 459,877 units and also among Indias Top 20 best-selling utility vehicles in FY2024 . Last fiscal, the XUV300 was the fifth high-selling Mahindra SUV model in FY2024 after the Scorpio, Bolero, XUV700 and the Thar. AUTO PUNDITZ February 2025 Mahindra Sales Analysis YoY, MoM Change, 6-Month Trend V3Cars Mar 20 4 min read In this February 2025 Mahindra car sales analysis, well look at the car sales of Mahindra for the previous month. Well also compare the YoY and MoM change to find out which Mahindra cars sales improved and which ones declined. To support the trends, well also provide our opinions where applicable. Lastly, the table with monthly sales for the last 6 months will give you an idea about the 6-month sales trend of all Mahindra cars. Mission Accomplished! Mahindra have finally managed to secure the 2nd spot for the first time ever. While Tata Motors have enjoyed the 2nd position a few times, this is an achievement for Mahindra. With a 13.24% market share in Feb 2025, Mahindra were only behind Maruti Suzuki while Hyundai and Tata secured 12.54% and 12.20% market share. We shouldnt expect anyone to beat Maruti Suzuki any time soon. So, 2nd spot is as high as any other carmaker can go and thats where well see Hyundai, Tata and Mahindra fighting it out in the coming months. They usually say once a flop, always a flop. But Mahindra showed the industry how they can turn around a flop product and turn it into a success. The XUV 300 did well for itself but it was not a sales success in its segment where segment leaders routinely hit close to 15,000 dispatches every month. It looked like it was impossible to turn its fate around but Mahindra did exactly that, that too in a much too crowded market. It has managed to make space for itself as it continues with a typical monthly dispatch figure of 7,000 - 9,000 averaging at 8,256. The fact that they achieved this with what the industry calls a mid-life update makes it all the more special. They not only gave it a new yet recognizable name, they revamped its exterior and interior design, revised the variant lineup, feature distribution and added a few segment first features to earn buyers respect. But what helped it the most was its value for money pricing. From there, like one sledgehammer hit after another, they brought out the new age electric cars and that finally got them enough volumes to beat Hyundai and attain 2nd place in Feb 2025. If the journey to get this far was tough, we can expect the path forward to be tougher for Mahindra. Tata & Hyundai are still not too far behind. Its going to be interesting to see the 3 manufacturers battling it out to grab the 2nd spot going forward until one of them leaves the other two so far behind that they instead focus on staying on the podium instead. By Ajit Dalvi 14 Feb 2025 12986 Views Share - The Mahindra XUV300, reborn in a new avatar in April 2024 as the XUV 3XO , turns six years old today. Launched on February 14 and Valentines Day in 2019, the popular compact SUV has, till end-January 2025, has sold a total of 335,017 units. Thanks to the XUV 3XO, this compact Mahindra SUVs growth trajectory is currently at its best yet since launch, having sold 85,990 units, up 80% YoY (April 2023-January 2024: 47,672 units). The launch of the XUV 3XO (above right) in April 2024 has accelerated sales. The 85,990 units sold in the first 10 months of FY2025 are up 80% YoY. At this pace, the 3XO will go on to hit the 100,000-units sales mark in FY2025. Not only are the XUV 3XOs sales in the first 10 months of FY2025 already the highest in a fiscal, having beaten the previous best of 60,968 units of FY2023, but with February-March 2025 sales yet to be pencilled in, they are set to hit the 100,000 sales mark in FY2025. In the process, this models cumulative sales since launch will also surpass 350,000 units. Whats amply clear is that the rollout of the XUV 3XO in end-April 2024 has accelerated sales. Year-on-year, M&M has sold an additional 38,318 units. This compact SUV is currently the second best-selling Mahindra SUV after the Scorpio twins (137,311 units). That the XUV300 would become another Mahindra high-selling SUV was seen soon after launch seven years ago the company received 13,000 bookings in the first 28 days . The Mahindra compact SUV went on to hit 200,000 sales in May 2023 , 47 months after launch. The 300,000 milestone came up 16 months later in early October 2024. Given the current rapid pace of sales, the 400,000 sales milestone should be achieved in even fewer months. At present, the 3XO is 65,747 units away from that big number and should hit it around August-September 2025. What is helping accelerate sales for this SUV is the gains coming from M&Ms heightened focus on safety. In mid-November 2024, the XUV 3XO, along with the Thar Roxx and XUV400, aced the Bharat NCAP crash test . These models have now joined Mahindras growing portfolio of five-star-rated vehicles, which includes the XUV700 and Scorpio-N. 3X0 AS A SALES ACCELERATOR TO MAHINDRAS STELLAR GROWTH In FY2024, with 54,726 units, the XUV300 contributed 12% to the companys dealer dispatches and was among the prime movers that powered M&M to its best-ever fiscal year sales of 459,877 units and also among Indias Top 20 best-selling utility vehicles in FY2024 . Last fiscal, the XUV300 was the fifth high-selling Mahindra SUV model in FY2024 after the Scorpio, Bolero, XUV700 and the Thar. But is it a good buy? Contents The XUV 3XO is not a new-gen model but an extensive facelift. And its just not on the design front, but also the offerings. Mahindra received more than 50,000 bookings within an hour, so things have started on a positive note. So should you ride the wave and buy it? Well, we tell you both sides of the story. Pro - Powertrain Options Carried over from the XUV300, the XUV 3XO comes with a variety of powertrain options. You have a choice of a turbo-petrol engine in two states of tune and a diesel engine as well. You also get the option of a 6-speed manual, a 6-speed AMT and the new Aisin-sourced 6-speed torque converter automatic. Powertrain Turbo-Petrol (TCMPFi) Turbo-Petrol (TGDi) Diesel Displacement 1197 cc 1197 cc 1497 cc Max Power 110 bhp @ 5000 rpm 129 bhp @ 5000 rpm 115 bhp @ 3750 rpm Peak Torque 200 Nm @ 1500-3500 rpm 230 Nm @ 1500-3750 rpm 300 Nm @ 1500-2500 rpm Transmission 6-Speed MT/ 6-Speed AT 6-Speed MT/ 6-Speed AT 6-Speed MT/ 6-Speed AMT Fuel efficiency 18.89 kmpl (MT)/ 17.96 kmpl (AT) 20.1 kmpl (MT)/ 18.2 kmpl (AT) 20.6 kmpl (MT)/ 21.2 kmpl (AMT) Surprisingly, the 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine with the higher state of tune is more frugal. But the diesel is unbeatable in terms of fuel efficiency as with the AMT it returns 21.2 kmpl. Pro - Ride Quality Mahindra has improved the already fantastic suspension from the XUV 300 with this facelift. The result is a steady ride. On big bumps, it is very poised and even smaller bumps are dealt with ease. Pro - Safety Features Theres a plethora of safety features on offer with the XUV 3XO. It gets 6 airbags, ESC, 3-point seatbelts with reminders for all seats and so many more safety features as standard. And then, the icing on the cake is that it's the first subcompact SUV with level 2 ADAS. Lets wait and watch how it performs at the Global NCAP crash tests. Pro - Prices Mahindra knocked it out of the park with the XUV 3XO. Only the Renault Kiger and Nissan Magnite have a lower starting price than the Mahindra. The top-end price of the XUV 3XO may be higher than its rivals but there is so much on offer here. Mahindra currently has an order backlog of around 2 lakh 20 thousand units, which includes 50,000 units of the XUV 3XO. While deliveries begin on May 26 it may be time before you get your hands on one if youre not one of those 50,000 people. Auto Industry Mahindra XUV 3XO Review: 5-Star Safety Meets Bold New Style Mahindra XUV 3XO Review: 5-Star Safety Meets Bold New Style The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compelling sub-compact SUV with segment-leading safety, powerful engines and new style in the market. NITISH MAJUMDER June 5, 2025 NITISH MAJUMDER June 5, 2025 NITISH MAJUMDER June 5, 2025 Facebook Telegram WhatsApp Twitter Copy Link The sub-compact SUV in India witnesseda huge disruption with the launch of the Mahindra XUV 3XO in April 2024. This heavily redesigned XUV300 successor has created a lot of buzz in the market, promising to fix the shortcomings of the previous model and introduce segment-first features. Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications Specification Details Price Range Rs. 7.99 15.80 Lakh (ex-showroom) Engine Options 1.2L Turbo Petrol (110 bhp), 1.2L TGDi (129 bhp), 1.5L Diesel (115 bhp) Transmission 6-speed Manual, 6-speed Automatic, 6-speed AMT Safety Rating 5-star BNCAP Mileage 17.96-21.2 kmpl (ARAI) Boot Space 295 liters Fuel Tank 42 liters Ground Clearance 201 mm Wheelbase 2600 mm Seating Capacity 5 passengers Engine and Variants The XUV 3XO continues with the same set of engines seen on theolder version, with three options. The base 1.2-litre turbo petrol makes 110 bhp and 200 Nm, good enough for city driving with decent fuel efficiency of around 17-19 kmpl. The highlight is new 1.2-litreTGDi direct injection petrol, good 129 bhp and 230 Nm. Theres adequate mid-rangepunch in this engine and highway overtaking is a breeze. The new torque converter automatic transmission works well with both petrol engines, smoother than the jerky AMT. For diesel lovers, the 1.5-litre turbo diesel continues to be the best in class with 300 Nm torque. The manual transmission is seamless, but the AMT is reluctant in lower gears, especially in stop-and-go traffic. Design and Styling Updates Mahindra has completely redesigned the XUV 3XOs exterior. The new front face features vertically arranged headlamps with C-shaped LED DRLs, making itlook related to the XUV700. The wide grille has diamond-shaped detailing and connected LED tail-lamps. The side profile has chunky cladding and 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels on higher variants. But the styling is divisive, some find it bold and fresh while others think its too dramatic for the segment. Interior Space and Features The cabin is a big upgrade over the previous model. Mahindra has given the XUV 3XO a free-standing 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system and matching digital instrument cluster, same as the XUV700. Space is excellent, with class-leading rear legroom for 5 adults. The dashboard has soft-touch materials and premium finishes on higher variants and plenty of storage spaces for practicality. Key Features: Panoramic sunroof (segment-first) Dual-zone automatic climate control 360-degree camera system Electronic parking brake with auto-hold Level 2 ADAS on top variants Safety and Build The XUV 3XOs biggest achievement is its 5-star BNCAP rating, making it one of the safest in the segment. All variants come with six airbags, all-wheel disc brakes and comprehensive safety features like ABS, EBD and ESP. Higher variants get advanced driver assistance features like forward collision warning, autonomous emergency braking, adaptive cruise control and lane-keep assist. The build quality is robust and users often praise it as tank-like. Updated on May 02, 2024 05:35:55 PM 87,098 Views Follow us on The XUV 3XO's styling is big on flash The diamond-shaped detailing on the lights and grille are a nice touch. The infotainment is now a 10.25-inch unit and works well. By Nikhil Bhatia Share - Make : Mahindra Model : XUV 3XO We Like Upmarket interior Strong engines Long equipment list We Don't Like Boot space Competent as the Mahindra XUV300 was, it never quite made it to the list of compact SUV bestsellers. Mahindra is now gunning for glory with the updated XUV300, christened the XUV 3XO. Mind you, this is no run-of-the-mill nip and tuck update. Mahindra has gone all out with a new look, redone interior, some class-first feature introductions, some class-best specifications and very enticing pricing. The aim is to take the fight to the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue, and win. Mahindra XUV 3XO: design and styling Where the XUV300s styling was understated, the XUV 3XO is big on flash. Giving the 3XO its distinctive face are the large, new vertically oriented headlights outlined by C-shaped DRLs (a link to the larger XUV700). The headlights are split into two sections with a concealed projector unit up top, and an open projector fog lamp unit lower down, both set amidst a black surround. The lights flank the new grille, which is actually a gloss panel that runs much of the XUVs width. The new front bumper with its pronounced cuts and creases is very concept car-like and the newly contoured bonnet also does its bit to add volume to the design. New C-shaped LED DRLs provide a visual link with the larger XUV700. Like the XUV300, the 3XO looks muscular in profile, and furthering the impression are the stylish new 17-inch diamond cut alloy wheels that are the largest in the segment. Theres also chunkier side cladding with cuts at the wheel arches. Mahindra says ground clearance is a generous 201mm, up from the XUV300s figure of 180mm. You have a choice of a turbo-petrol engine in two states of tune and a diesel engine as well. On big bumps, it is very poised and even smaller bumps are dealt with ease. Pro - Safety Features Theres a plethora of safety features on offer with the XUV 3XO. It gets 6 airbags, ESC, 3-point seatbelts with reminders for all seats and so many more safety features as standard. NITISH MAJUMDER June 5, 2025 NITISH MAJUMDER June 5, 2025 NITISH MAJUMDER June 5, 2025 Facebook Telegram WhatsApp Twitter Copy Link The sub-compact SUV in India witnesseda huge disruption with the launch of the Mahindra XUV 3XO in April 2024. This heavily redesigned XUV300 successor has created a lot of buzz in the market, promising to fix the shortcomings of the previous model and introduce segment-first features. Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications Specification Details Price Range Rs. 7.99 15.80 Lakh (ex-showroom) Engine Options 1.2L Turbo Petrol (110 bhp), 1.2L TGDi (129 bhp), 1.5L Diesel (115 bhp) Transmission 6-speed Manual, 6-speed Automatic, 6-speed AMT Safety Rating 5-star BNCAP Mileage 17.96-21.2 kmpl (ARAI) Boot Space 295 liters Fuel Tank 42 liters Ground Clearance 201 mm Wheelbase 2600 mm Seating Capacity 5 passengers Engine and Variants The XUV 3XO continues with the same set of engines seen on theolder version, with three options. The base 1.2-litre turbo petrol makes 110 bhp and 200 Nm, good enough for city driving with decent fuel efficiency of around 17-19 kmpl. The highlight is new 1.2-litreTGDi direct injection petrol, good 129 bhp and 230 Nm. Theres adequate mid-rangepunch in this engine and highway overtaking is a breeze. The new torque converter automatic transmission works well with both petrol engines, smoother than the jerky AMT. For diesel lovers, the 1.5-litre turbo diesel continues to be the best in class with 300 Nm torque. The manual transmission is seamless, but the AMT is reluctant in lower gears, especially in stop-and-go traffic. Design and Styling Updates Mahindra has completely redesigned the XUV 3XOs exterior. The new front face features vertically arranged headlamps with C-shaped LED DRLs, making itlook related to the XUV700. The wide grille has diamond-shaped detailing and connected LED tail-lamps. The side profile has chunky cladding and 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels on higher variants. But the styling is divisive, some find it bold and fresh while others think its too dramatic for the segment. Interior Space and Features The cabin is a big upgrade over the previous model. Mahindra has given the XUV 3XO a free-standing 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system and matching digital instrument cluster, same as the XUV700. Space is excellent, with class-leading rear legroom for 5 adults. The dashboard has soft-touch materials and premium finishes on higher variants and plenty of storage spaces for practicality. Key Features: Panoramic sunroof (segment-first) Dual-zone automatic climate control 360-degree camera system Electronic parking brake with auto-hold Level 2 ADAS on top variants Safety and Build The XUV 3XOs biggest achievement is its 5-star BNCAP rating, making it one of the safest in the segment. All variants come with six airbags, all-wheel disc brakes and comprehensive safety features like ABS, EBD and ESP. Higher variants get advanced driver assistance features like forward collision warning, autonomous emergency braking, adaptive cruise control and lane-keep assist. The build quality is robust and users often praise it as tank-like. Executive Summary Market Analysis XUV 3XO Overview Luxury & Safety Sales Performance Market Trends Conclusion
☰ SUV Analysis

Executive Summary

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compelling subcompact SUV that has garnered significant attention in the Indian automotive market. This report provides a detailed analysis of the SUV segment, focusing on the XUV 3XO's features, specifications, sales performance, and market trends. The XUV 3XO stands out with its bold design, advanced technology, and comprehensive safety features, making it a strong contender in the competitive SUV market.

This section provides a high-level overview of the key findings and strategic implications related to the Mahindra XUV 3XO and the SUV market segment.

  • Mahindra XUV 3XO is a feature-rich and power-packed compact SUV.
  • The SUV has a 5-star safety rating, making it one of the safest in its segment.
  • Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a range of engine options, including petrol and diesel.
  • The car comes with a new 6-speed AT gearbox for the turbo-petrol engine.
Model Sales
Scorpio / N 12,740
Thar / ROXX 9,542
Bolero 7,478
XUV3XO 7,089
XUV700 6,198

SUV Market Analysis.

The global SUV market has witnessed remarkable growth, driven by changing consumer preferences, technological advancements, and the introduction of new models. The market is projected to reach 53 million units by 2030, with a CAGR of 4.4% from 2024. Key trends include the rising popularity of compact and subcompact SUVs, the increasing demand for electric SUVs, and the integration of advanced safety and driver-assistance systems. In India, Mahindra has emerged as a key player, with its SUV portfolio contributing significantly to its overall sales.

This section provides a comprehensive analysis of the SUV market, including market size, growth trends, key drivers, and challenges.

  • Global SUV market is projected to reach 53 million units by 2030.
  • Electric SUVs are gaining popularity due to stricter emission regulations.
  • Compact and subcompact SUVs are witnessing increased demand.
  • SUVs offer versatility, space, and a higher driving position.
Year Market Size (USD Billion) CAGR (%)
2024 2.97 -
2025 3.04 2.5
2033 3.71 2.5

Mahindra XUV 3XO Overview.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compact SUV that blends bold design with advanced technology. Launched in April 2024, it is a refreshed version of the XUV300, featuring significant upgrades in design and technology. The SUV boasts a bold front grille, connected LED tail lamps, and a panoramic sunroof. Inside, it offers dual 10.25-inch displays for the infotainment system and driver's instrument cluster, wireless charging, and a cooled glove box. It comes with level 2 ADAS and 6 airbags and electronic stability control.

This section provides a general overview of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, including its design, features, and key specifications.

  • Mahindra XUV 3XO is a refreshed version of the XUV300.
  • The SUV features a bold design with connected LED tail lamps.
  • It offers dual 10.25-inch displays for infotainment and instrument cluster.
  • Safety is prioritized with Level 2 ADAS and six airbags.

Detailed Analysis of Luxury and Safety Features.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a range of luxury and safety features that enhance the driving experience and ensure passenger safety. Luxury features include a panoramic sunroof, premium audio system, wireless charging, and a cooled glove box. Safety features include six airbags, Electronic Stability Control (ESC), ABS, all-wheel disc brakes, TPMS, seatbelt reminders for all passengers, and Level 2 ADAS. The ADAS features include forward collision warning, autonomous emergency braking, adaptive cruise control, and lane-keep assist.

This section provides an in-depth analysis of the luxury and safety features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, highlighting the key technologies and their benefits.

  • Mahindra XUV 3XO offers luxury features like panoramic sunroof and premium audio.
  • The car has six airbags, ESC, ABS, and all-wheel disc brakes for enhanced safety.
  • It is equipped with Level 2 ADAS for advanced driver assistance.
  • The safety features are a core selling point, making it a safe choice for family SUV

Sales Performance Analysis.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has demonstrated strong sales performance since its launch. In June 2025, the total sales figure of XUV 3XO was 7,089 units, which represents a 10.85% MoM decline. The SUV recorded 98,091 unit sales in FY2024-25 (April 2024 to March 2025 period) as against 53,962 units during the same period the previous fiscal, witnessing a YoY sales surge of 82%. The launch month of May 2024 saw 10,000 units dispatched, setting a strong tone right from the start. These figures demonstrate the growing demand for the XUV 3XO in the Indian market.

This section analyzes the sales performance of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, including monthly sales figures, YoY growth, and market share.

  • Total sales for June 2025 stood at 7,089 units.
  • FY2024-25 sales recorded 98,091 units, representing 82% YoY growth.
  • In May 2024 Mahindra dispatched 10,000 units of XUV 3XO.
  • The XUV 3XO drives the brand's monthly numbers.

Market Trends and Future Outlook.

The SUV market is expected to continue its growth trajectory, driven by factors such as increasing disposable incomes, urbanization, and the demand for versatile vehicles. Electric SUVs are poised to gain prominence as automakers invest in sustainable technologies and governments implement stricter emission regulations. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is well-positioned to capitalize on these trends, with its competitive pricing, advanced features, and focus on safety. Future models include both fully electric and hybrid.

This section discusses the future trends in the SUV market and the potential opportunities for the Mahindra XUV 3XO.

  • SUV market is expected to grow due to rising incomes and urbanization.
  • Electric SUVs are gaining prominence.
  • Mahindra XUV 3XO is well-positioned to capitalize on these trends.
  • Future models will likely include electric and hybrid options.

Conclusion.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compelling subcompact SUV that offers a blend of style, performance, safety, and advanced features. It has demonstrated strong sales performance and is well-positioned to compete in the growing SUV market. The SUV's comprehensive safety features, luxurious interiors, and competitive pricing make it an attractive option for consumers looking for a versatile and reliable vehicle. Mahindra's commitment to innovation and safety will likely further strengthen the XUV 3XO's position in the market.

This section summarizes the key findings of the report and provides a final assessment of the Mahindra XUV 3XO's prospects in the SUV market.

  • Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compelling subcompact SUV.
  • It offers a blend of style, performance, and safety.
  • SUV is well-positioned to compete in the growing SUV market.
  • Mahindra is committed to continuous innovation and safety.

Mahindra XUV 3XO Overview.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compact SUV that blends bold design with advanced technology. Launched in April 2024, it is a refreshed version of the XUV300, featuring significant upgrades in design and technology. The SUV boasts a bold front grille, connected LED tail lamps, and a panoramic sunroof. Inside, it offers dual 10.25-inch displays for the infotainment system and driver's instrument cluster, wireless charging, and a cooled glove box. It comes with level 2 ADAS and 6 airbags and electronic stability control.

This section provides a general overview of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, including its design, features, and key specifications.

  • Mahindra XUV 3XO is a refreshed version of the XUV300.
  • The SUV features a bold design with connected LED tail lamps.
  • It offers dual 10.25-inch displays for infotainment and instrument cluster.
  • Safety is prioritized with Level 2 ADAS and six airbags.

Detailed Analysis of Luxury and Safety Features.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a range of luxury and safety features that enhance the driving experience and ensure passenger safety. Luxury features include a panoramic sunroof, premium audio system, wireless charging, and a cooled glove box. Safety features include six airbags, Electronic Stability Control (ESC), ABS, all-wheel disc brakes, TPMS, seatbelt reminders for all passengers, and Level 2 ADAS. The ADAS features include forward collision warning, autonomous emergency braking, adaptive cruise control, and lane-keep assist.

This section provides an in-depth analysis of the luxury and safety features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, highlighting the key technologies and their benefits.

  • It is equipped with Level 2 ADAS for advanced driver assistance.
  • The safety features are a core selling point, making it a safe choice for family SUV

Sales Performance Analysis.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has demonstrated strong sales performance since its launch. In June 2025, the total sales figure of XUV 3XO was 7,089 units, which represents a 10.85% MoM decline. The SUV recorded 98,091 unit sales in FY2024-25 (April 2024 to March 2025 period) as against 53,962 units during the same period the previous fiscal, witnessing a YoY sales surge of 82%. The launch month of May 2024 saw 10,000 units dispatched, setting a strong tone right from the start. These figures demonstrate the growing demand for the XUV 3XO in the Indian market.

Market Trends and Future Outlook.

The SUV market is expected to continue its growth trajectory, driven by factors such as increasing disposable incomes, urbanization, and the demand for versatile vehicles. Electric SUVs are poised to gain prominence as automakers invest in sustainable technologies and governments implement stricter emission regulations. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is well-positioned to capitalize on these trends, with its competitive pricing, advanced features, and focus on safety. Future models include both fully electric and hybrid.

Conclusion.

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compelling subcompact SUV that offers a blend of style, performance, safety, and advanced features. It has demonstrated strong sales performance and is well-positioned to compete in the growing SUV market. The SUV's comprehensive safety features, luxurious interiors, and competitive pricing make it an attractive option for consumers looking for a versatile and reliable vehicle. Mahindra's commitment to innovation and safety will likely further strengthen the XUV 3XO's position in the market.
